'''''Rhûn''''' is a song composed by [[Bear McCreary]] for the [[Where the Stars are Strange|second episode]] of the second season of ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]]''. It features lyrics sung in [[Rhûnnic]] by [[The Mystery of the Bulgarian Voices]]. According to Bear McCreary, the language the lyrics were sung in was crafted from some of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s unpublished notes which some Tolkien scholars had unearthed.<ref>[https://bearmccreary.com/the-lord-of-the-rings-episode-202/ The Lord of the Rings: Episode 202], by [[Bear McCreary]], oct. 15, 2024.</ref>

==Lyrics==
<poem>
''Fú nimžil, nimžil-feg,''
''aibesjar balan taugun.''
''Dunšig Lún,''
''ligrám lihiš bódi aišäd bil.''

''Dyúl hez ní, feč Šigór.''
''þabul nädo naþa-feg je.''
''dyúl gileg anže þurfeg jai.''
''Dyúl hez ní, feč Šigór.''
''gorul arkädfeg go,''
''þur če žilid-feg bil.''
''I Raib-aišäd.''
</poem>

==Translation==
The [[Rhûnnic]] text above along with its following translation were published by Amazon's composer Bear McCreary on his personal website<ref>[https://bearmccreary.com/the-lord-of-the-rings-episode-202/ The Lord of the Rings: Episode 202], by [[Bear McCreary]], oct. 15, 2024.</ref>.
<poem>
''Under moonlight, moonlight thine,''
''Our sister carried far.''
''Dark Magic,''
''White wings beat in sacred shrine.''

''Command her, thou Istar.''
''Grant flesh to thy servant.''
''Bring her forth with your might.''
''Command her, thou Istar.''
''Rise from thy throne,''
''In thy power and splendor.''
''The border shrine.''
</poem>
